**Hello!** I am [**Gustavo Marín**](https://www.cenicafe.org/es/index.php/quienes_somos/nuestra_gente/quienes_somos_gustavo_adolfo_marin_ramirez), a Ph.D. candidate in the [Plant Pathology graduate program at the Federal University of Viçosa](https://www.dfp.ufv.br/), Brazil. I am an Agronomist from the [National University of Colombia (Palmira)](https://www.palmira.unal.edu.co/) and obtained my Master's degree in Plant Pathology in 2015 from the [Federal University of Viçosa](https://www.ufv.br/campus-vicosa/).

### Welcome to my website

This site was created with great enthusiasm using Quarto Markdown for the course **FIP606 - Data Analysis and Visualization in Plant Pathology**, taught by Professor [Emerson Del Ponte](https://emersondelponte.netlify.app/). Here you will find class materials, organized thematically and designed to facilitate learning.

### What will you find on this site?

-   **Class materials:** Documents, presentations, and resources used during classes.
-   **R tutorials:** Step-by-step guides for analyzing and visualizing phytopathological data using R.
-   **Projects and examples:** Practical cases that will help you better understand the use of analysis tools in the field of plant pathology.

### Exploring the fascinating world of phytopathological data analysis

This site is designed for beginners in R and those interested in phytopathological data analysis. As you navigate through the different sections, you will find information and resources to help you develop your skills in R and apply this knowledge to plant pathology.

### Contact me!

If you have any questions or need more information, feel free to contact me. I am here to help you on your learning journey.
